meanings.definition: a person or thing that is extremely hardworking and reliable
meanings.sent1: The workhorse of the team, Sarah always completes her tasks on time.
meanings.sent2: The old truck was the workhorse of the delivery service, never breaking down.
meanings.sent3: The workhorse stapler never complained about the heavy workload.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to the project made him the workhorse of the group.
meanings.sent5: The workhorse computer never slowed down, even with multiple programs running.

meanings.definition: a horse used for heavy labor
meanings.sent1: The workhorse pulled the heavy cart up the hill effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The farmer's workhorse was strong and reliable, plowing the fields every day.
meanings.sent3: The workhorse neighed happily as it trotted along with the heavy load.
meanings.sent4: The workhorse's hooves pounded the ground rhythmically as it worked.
meanings.sent5: The workhorse's muscles rippled under its shiny coat as it pulled the wagon.

meanings.definition: a machine or vehicle that is durable and efficient in performing tasks
meanings.sent1: The workhorse printer churned out copies without any jams.
meanings.sent2: The workhorse tractor plowed the fields from dawn till dusk.
meanings.sent3: The workhorse of the factory, the machine never needed repairs.
meanings.sent4: The workhorse engine hummed steadily as the boat sailed smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The workhorse truck never failed to deliver goods on time.
